DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Study A Viscoelastic-free Method Implantable Collamer Lens ( ICL ) Implantation
DOC.detailed_description: Implantable Collamer Lens ( ICL ) implantation prove effective refractive option surgical correction high myopia . Currently , standard method utilizing viscoelastic agent fill maintain anterior chamber implantation , require additional step remove viscoelastic agent end surgery may cause intraocular pressure spike early post-operative phase due incomplete removal viscoelastics . The new method viscoelastic-free , achieve use balanced salt solution irrigation implantation . This study prospective randomize control trial compare safety efficacy viscoelastic-free method standard method . Subjects enrol study randomize receive either viscoelastic-free method standard method , clinical outcome two group assess several follow-up : 2 hour , 1 day , 1 week , 1 month , 3 month 6 month post-operatively .
DOC.criteria: Documented stable refraction least 1 year ( within 0.5D ) Best spectaclecorrected visual acuity ( BCVA ) 20/40 good Clear central cornea 0.5D 18.0D myopic refractive error Normal anterior chamber depth least 2.8 mm endothelium Endothelial cell density ( ECD ) 2000 cell/mm2 Pupil diameter small 7.0 mm mesopic condition Discontinued 3 week hard contact lens 1 week soft contact lens wear Preexisting ocular disease condition myopia , evidence progressive acute ocular disease Evidence connective tissue disease systemic disease may confound result study ; Narrow angle anterior chamber Pregnant , lactating , plan become pregnant course trial
